quoteFirst: of fluid, representing the extract of 2,000 grams of _Aragallus lamberti_. The temperature at the time of feeding, 1.10 p. m., was 105.3°F. At
quoteLast: the sheep could be easily turned on its back. At 2.23 p.m. the temperature was 103.6°F. At 3.42 p.m. the temperature was 103.5°F. At 4.20 p.m. the respiration was fairly rapid. On July 14, at 11.15 a.m., the temperature was 103.6°F. The sheep would run about but could easily be turned over.
title: Barium: A Cause of the Loco-Weed Disease
author: Crawford, Albert Cornelius

quoteFirst: In some respects the attack was peculiar. As was so often the case, the direction of the attack was at an angle to our front, and the London Scottish, starting the assault from the right at 1.45 p.m., were followed by the 4th London Regt. at 1.47 and the Rangers at
quoteLast: ; this was calculated to bring the three battalions into line by the time Dewdrop and the gun-pits were reached.
title: The 56th Division (1st London Territorial Division)
author: Dudley Ward, C. H. (Charles Humble), 1879-; Horne, Henry, 1861-1929 [Author of introduction, etc.]

quoteLast: _, when the manœuvre had been performed by the _Mikasa_ and _Shikishima_ (two only out of the twelve), the _Suvoroff_ fired the first shot at a range of 6,400 yards, and the guns of the whole fleet thundered forth. I watched closely through my glasses. The shots which went over and those which fell short were all close, but the most interesting, _i.e.
title:
The Battle of Tsu-shima
between the Japanese and Russian fleets, fought on 27th May 1905
author: Semenov, V. I. (Vladimir Ivanovich), 1867-1910; Lindsay, A. B. (Alexander Bertram), 1872-1914 [Translator]
